Subjective: Profound fatigue for ~2 months. Wakes up tired despite sleeping a lot; sleep possibly superficial. Increased muscle pain, back pain, and morning stiffness. Impact: Continues working but with difficulty; no energy after work; rests on weekends. Physical activity maintained (climbing 2-3x/week, cycling). No decline in strength or conditioning. Negatives: No clear trigger, no snoring, no shortness of breath, no palpitations, no chest pain, no appetite/weight change (stable 72kg), no change in bowel/urinary habits, no specific joint pain. Social: Active lifestyle. ICE (Concern): Worried about an underlying physical issue, specifically rheumatism, after online search.
Objective: Vitals: BP 110/60, HR 40-60 bpm. Lungs: Clear to auscultation. Heart: Normal sounds. Abdomen: Soft, non-tender, lively peristalsis, normal percussion. Musculoskeletal: Tender on palpation paravertebrally in lower back. No pain on pelvic compression. Neck and shoulders have full range of motion without pain.
Assessment: Fatigue, unspecified. Differential diagnosis includes anemia, thyroid dysfunction, and inflammatory conditions. Rheumatoid arthritis less likely given absence of specific joint pain.
Plan: 1. Labs: Order blood tests to check for anemia, thyroid function, and inflammation markers. 2. Follow-up: Patient to schedule blood draw. Call clinic for results and to schedule a phone appointment the day after results are available. 3. Logistics: Lab form sent to patient's inbox.
